abstract: The judge overseeing the bankruptcy of Chrysler on Tuesday took a significant step toward allowing the sale of most of the automaker to Fiat, approving the bidding procedures advocated by the company and backed by the Obama administration, The New York Times’s Michael J. de la Merced and Jonathan D. Glater reported.
lead_paragraph: The judge overseeing the bankruptcy of Chrysler on Tuesday took a significant step toward allowing the sale of most of the automaker to Fiat, approving the bidding procedures advocated by the company and backed by the Obama administration, The New York Times’s Michael J. de la Merced and Jonathan D. Glater reported.

headline.main: Plan to Sell Chrysler to Fiat Clears Bar

abstract: Leave for vacation without setting your TiVo to record that special show this week?
snippet: Leave for vacation without setting your TiVo to record that special show this week?
lead_paragraph: Leave for vacation without setting your TiVo to record that special show this week? Just point your cellphone’s browser to m.tivo.com, log into your TiVo account and set the DVR to snag the show you want to see. (TiVo recorders connected to home broadband networks are supposed to check in to the company’s servers every 15 minutes for new recording requests, so you can even record a show in the near future.) Check out tinyurl.com/dnb2mx for details. J. D. BIERSDORFER

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Using a Cellphone to Set Your TiVo
